title: Render all app text as bright white via theme tokens and utility audit

requirements.summary: Update global theme text color tokens so all theme-driven text renders as bright/pure white across the UI.
acceptanceCriteria: The Tailwind `text-foreground` color renders as pure/bright white on all pages.
Tailwind classes that currently render non-white text via theme tokens (e.g., `text-muted-foreground`, `text-card-foreground`, `text-popover-foreground`, etc.) now render bright white as well.
No page shows gray/green-tinted body text due to theme variables; text is consistently bright white in both normal and dark mode.

file_operations.description: Set theme CSS variables for `--foreground`, `--muted-foreground`, and all `* -foreground` variants (e.g., card/popover/secondary/accent/primary/destructive foreground tokens) to pure white (OKLCH white) in both `:root` and `.dark`, ensuring Tailwind theme tokens like `text-foreground`, `text-muted-foreground`, `text-card-foreground`, and `text-popover-foreground` render bright white consistently.

requirements.summary: Remove/replace hard-coded non-white Tailwind text color utilities so all visible text (including links, icons, and footer attribution) renders bright white.
acceptanceCriteria: No visible text uses hard-coded non-white Tailwind text colors anywhere in the app UI.
The footer attribution line (including the heart icon/text) renders in bright white.
Links and hover states remain readable and do not introduce non-white text colors.

file_operations.description: Replace hard-coded non-white text utilities in the footer (e.g., the `text-red-500` heart and any other explicit non-white text colors) with bright-white theme tokens (e.g., `text-foreground`) so the entire attribution line renders bright white while keeping hover states readable.

Update hard-coded non-white text utility usage for visible text elements (notably links currently using `text-primary`) to use bright-white theme tokens (e.g., `text-foreground` and appropriate hover/underline utilities) so links remain readable without introducing non-white text colors.

Update the external registration link styling that currently uses a hard-coded non-white text utility (e.g., `text-primary`) to use bright-white theme tokens (e.g., `text-foreground`) while preserving hover/underline readability.

Update the fallback link styling that currently uses a hard-coded non-white text utility (e.g., `text-primary`) to use bright-white theme tokens (e.g., `text-foreground`) while preserving hover/underline readability.

Update any hard-coded non-white icon/text utilities (e.g., `text-primary` on step icons and similar) to use bright-white theme tokens (e.g., `text-foreground`) so navigation tiles render consistently bright white.
